thread.title: E5 Group Looks Into Bolstering NATO's Air Defence Over Poland
thread.title_full: E5 Group Looks Into Bolstering NATO's Air Defence Over Poland

author: marketing@menafn.com (MENAFN)
title: E5 Group Looks Into Bolstering NATO's Air Defence Over Poland
text:
E5 Group Looks Into Bolstering NATO's Air Defence Over Poland
(
Speaking after talks in London with defence officials from Poland, Italy, France and Germany, Healey; according to a ministry statement, said: "The defence secretary has tasked the military with looking at how the UK can help bolster Nato's air defence over Poland, after Russia sent drones into Polish territory that were shot down.
Healey said that the E5 Group of Five Nations' message to Putin is that his "aggression only serves to strengthen the unity between our Nato nations," and that the war "only serves to strengthen our determination to stand with Ukraine."
He accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of "testing" Western allies after a number of drones strayed into the eastern European country's airspace during a widespread attack in western Ukraine.
Healey said the West is facing a "new era of threat," warning that Putin has displayed a "new level of hostility against Europe."
Closing out his address, he said: "We leave here today as E5 nations - Europe's top defence spenders - more united, more determined to confront this new era of threat, to step up further for Ukraine and to continue to boost our defence spending, as we increase war-fighting readiness.
On his part, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said the Alliance is "vigilant" and will defend "every inch" of its territory, in a message to Putin.
British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Wednesday he was deeply concerned by the violation of Polish and NATO airspace by Russian drones during an air attack on Ukraine, calling it an "extremely reckless" move by Moscow.
"This morning's barbaric attack on Ukraine and the egregious and unprecedented violation of Polish and NATO airspace by Russian drones is deeply concerning," Starmer said in a statement. (end)
nbs
MENAFN- Kuwait News Agency (KUNA)) LONDON, Sept 10 (KUNA) -- UK Defence Secretary John Healey chaired the E5 Group of Five Defence Summit on Wednesday.Speaking after talks in London with defence officials from Poland, Italy, France and Germany, Healey; according to a ministry statement, said: "The defence secretary has tasked the military with looking at how the UK can help bolster Nato's air defence over Poland, after Russia sent drones into Polish territory that were shot down.
Healey said that the E5 Group of Five Nations' message to Putin is that his "aggression only serves to strengthen the unity between our Nato nations," and that the war "only serves to strengthen our determination to stand with Ukraine."
He accused Russian President Vladimir Putin of "testing" Western allies after a number of drones strayed into the eastern European country's airspace during a widespread attack in western Ukraine.
Healey said the West is facing a "new era of threat," warning that Putin has displayed a "new level of hostility against Europe."
Closing out his address, he said: "We leave here today as E5 nations - Europe's top defence spenders - more united, more determined to confront this new era of threat, to step up further for Ukraine and to continue to boost our defence spending, as we increase war-fighting readiness.
On his part, NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte said the Alliance is "vigilant" and will defend "every inch" of its territory, in a message to Putin.
British Prime Minister Keir Starmer said on Wednesday he was deeply concerned by the violation of Polish and NATO airspace by Russian drones during an air attack on Ukraine, calling it an "extremely reckless" move by Moscow.
"This morning's barbaric attack on Ukraine and the egregious and unprecedented violation of Polish and NATO airspace by Russian drones is deeply concerning," Starmer said in a statement. (end)
